lexUnit.name: cup.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: chiefly N. Amer. a measure of capacity used in cookery, equal to half a US pint (0.237 litre)

sentence.text: Nothing could , perhaps , convey better the collapse of a regime than this picture of a faithful attendant carrying a cup of soup through a deserted palace , to an Empress asleep in a chair .

He waved the clerk to a seat and served him a cup of watered wine .
He smilingly proffered me a cup of watered wine in one of the goblets I had hidden away the previous evening .
She had a cup of Bovril , and she met Ken from Coronation Street .
On washing day I fill a bucket half full of very hot water and add my cup of soap powder before going back to the house for breakfast .

Ludo wants to make me a cup of hot chocolate .
We kept awake with cups of cocoa , which was off the ration .

I desperately needed a cup of coffee .
